chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall p : positive, iad_conv_prop p /\ iad_conv_prop p~0 /\ iad_conv_prop p~1

Premises:
Inductive positive : Set := xI : positive -> positive | xO : positive -> positive | xH : positive For xI: Argument scope is [positive_scope] For xO: Argument scope is [positive_scope]
iad_conv_prop = fun p : positive => (exists q : positive, p = iad_conv_aux_0 q) \/ (exists q : positive, p = iad_conv_aux_1 q) \/ (exists q r : positive, p = iad_conv_aux_2 q r) : positive -> Prop Argument scope is [positive_scope]
iad_conv_surj_0 : forall p : positive, iad_conv_prop p -> iad_conv_prop p~0~0
iad_conv_surj_3 : forall p : positive, iad_conv_prop p -> iad_conv_prop p~1~1
iad_conv_surj_2 : forall p : positive, iad_conv_prop p -> iad_conv_prop p~0~1
iad_conv_surj_1 : forall p : positive, iad_conv_prop p -> iad_conv_prop p~1~0
pl_compat = fun pl0 pl1 : prec_list => pl0 = prec_empty /\ pl1 = prec_empty \/ pl0 <> prec_empty /\ pl1 <> prec_empty : prec_list -> prec_list -> Prop
Pos.xI_succ_xO : forall p : positive, (p~1)%positive = Pos.succ p~0
Pos2Nat.inj_xO : forall p : positive, Pos.to_nat p~0 = 2 * Pos.to_nat p
Pos.peanoView_xI : forall p : positive, Pos.PeanoView p -> Pos.PeanoView p~1
Pos2Z.pos_xI : forall p : positive, Z.pos p~1 = (2 * Z.pos p + 1)%Z
Pos2Z.neg_xI : forall p : positive, Z.neg p~1 = (2 * Z.neg p - 1)%Z
Pos2Z.inj_xI : forall p : positive, Z.pos p~1 = (2 * Z.pos p + 1)%Z
Pos2Nat.inj_xI : forall p : positive, Pos.to_nat p~1 = S (2 * Pos.to_nat p)
EnvRing.Mjump_xO_tail : forall (R : Type) (rI : R) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (M : EnvRing.Mon) (p : positive) (l : Env.Env R), EnvRing.Mphi rI rmul (Env.jump p~0 (Env.tail l)) M = EnvRing.Mphi rI rmul (Env.jump p~1 l) M
EnvRing.Pjump_xO_tail : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (C : Type) (phi : C -> R) (P : EnvRing.Pol C) (p : positive) (l : Env.Env R), EnvRing.Pphi radd rmul phi (Env.jump p~0 (Env.tail l)) P = EnvRing.Pphi radd rmul phi (Env.jump p~1 l) P
Ndouble_plus_one_inv_xI : forall (x : ad) (p : positive), N.succ_double x = N.pos p~1 -> x = N.pos p
BinPosDef.Pos.double_mask = fun x : BinPosDef.Pos.mask => match x with | BinPosDef.Pos.IsNul => BinPosDef.Pos.IsNul | BinPosDef.Pos.IsPos p => BinPosDef.Pos.IsPos p~0 | BinPosDef.Pos.IsNeg => BinPosDef.Pos.IsNeg end : BinPosDef.Pos.mask -> BinPosDef.Pos.mask
BinPosDef.Pos.Ndouble = fun n : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => N.pos p~0 end : N -> N Argument scope is [N_scope]
BinIntDef.Z.pred_double = fun x : Z => match x with | 0%Z => (-1)%Z | Z.pos p => Z.pos (Pos.pred_double p) | Z.neg p => Z.neg p~1 end : Z -> Z Argument scope is [Z_scope]
BinIntDef.Z.succ_double = fun x : Z => match x with | 0%Z => 1%Z | Z.pos p => Z.pos p~1 | Z.neg p => Z.neg (Pos.pred_double p) end : Z -> Z Argument scope is [Z_scope]
BinNatDef.N.succ_double = fun x : N => match x with | 0%N => 1%N | N.pos p => N.pos p~1 end : N -> N Argument scope is [N_scope]
BinPosDef.Pos.Nsucc_double = fun x : N => match x with | 0%N => 1%N | N.pos p => N.pos p~1 end : N -> N Argument scope is [N_scope]
positive_sind : forall P : positive -> SProp, (forall p : positive, P p -> P (p~1)%positive) -> (forall p : positive, P p -> P (p~0)%positive) -> P 1%positive -> forall p : positive, P p
positive_ind : forall P : positive -> Prop, (forall p : positive, P p -> P (p~1)%positive) -> (forall p : positive, P p -> P (p~0)%positive) -> P 1%positive -> forall p : positive, P p
positive_rect : forall P : positive -> Type, (forall p : positive, P p -> P (p~1)%positive) -> (forall p : positive, P p -> P (p~0)%positive) -> P 1%positive -> forall p : positive, P p
positive_rec : forall P : positive -> Set, (forall p : positive, P p -> P (p~1)%positive) -> (forall p : positive, P p -> P (p~0)%positive) -> P 1%positive -> forall p : positive, P p
BinPosDef.Pos.succ_double_mask = fun x : BinPosDef.Pos.mask => match x with | BinPosDef.Pos.IsNul => BinPosDef.Pos.IsPos 1 | BinPosDef.Pos.IsPos p => BinPosDef.Pos.IsPos p~1 | BinPosDef.Pos.IsNeg => BinPosDef.Pos.IsNeg end : BinPosDef.Pos.mask -> BinPosDef.Pos.mask
Nneg_bit0_2 : forall (a a' : N) (p : positive), N.lxor a a' = N.pos p~1 -> N.odd a = negb (N.odd a')
Pos.sub_mask_pos : forall p q : positive, (q < p)%positive -> exists r : positive, Pos.sub_mask p q = Pos.IsPos r
Pos.mul_1_r : forall p : positive, (p * 1)%positive = p
Pos.sub_mask_carry_spec : forall p q : positive, Pos.sub_mask_carry p q = Pos.pred_mask (Pos.sub_mask p q)
